\\ \text{Let A be the point where the tangent and}\\ \text{normal are. Given that, }\textbf{are the values}\\ \textbf{in the table below correct?} \\ (\mathbf{m_T} = \text{Tangent's slope, }\mathbf{m_N} = \text{Normal's slope.})

reason.tex: \text{When }x = f(\theta)\text{ and }y=g(\theta),\text{ then the}\\ \text{resulting curve is called a parametric curve.}\\ \theta\text{ is the parameter.}\\ \text{We get the graph by rotating the line L}\\ \text{from }0\text{ to }2\pi.\text{At each angle, we then} \\ \text{plot the point A given by }A = \left(f(\theta), g(\theta)\right).

\text{We know }A, m_T\text{ and }m_N.\text{ We therefore,}\\ \text{only need to apply }\\ \quad \dfrac{y-y_1}{x-x_1} = m \\ \begin{align} \text{Tangent} &: \dfrac{y-\dfrac{a}{2\sqrt{2}}}{x-\dfrac{a}{2\sqrt{2}}} = -1 \implies x + y = \dfrac{a}{\sqrt{2}} \\ \text{Normal} &: \dfrac{y-\dfrac{a}{2\sqrt{2}}}{x-\dfrac{a}{2\sqrt{2}}} = 1 \implies y = x \end{align}
